item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeMichael B. HancockHey Denver! My team will be providing free food boxes, flu shots, baby items and vouchers...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeMichael B. Hancock

Hey Denver! My team will be providing free food boxes, flu shots, baby items and vouchers for turkeys - as our families prepare for #Thanksgiving. Join us this ...Friday, from 10a to 2p or until supplies last. Remember to wear your mask and please share! üò∑ü¶Éüó£

Hola Denver, mientras las familias se preparan para el D√≠a de Acci√≥n de Gracias, mi equipo entregar√° cupones para pavos en nuestra distribuci√≥n semanal de alimentos este viernes en el la Escuela Lalo Delgado. item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeShowing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denverüì£Call To Actionüì£ Contact Your Denver City Council people...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeShowing Up for Racial Justice - SURJ Denver

üì£Call To Actionüì£

Contact Your Denver City Council people (including At-Large - Ortega & Kniech) and ask:

‚Ä¢ What is the status of collective bargaining with Denv...er Police Dept?
‚Ä¢ Will you commit to allow the police contract to go to arbitration?
‚Ä¢ Will you commit to no raises for DPD?

DEMAND - no new raises for Denver Police Department!

A 2-year contract with DPD is not just irresponsible, it is immoral. The current contract allows DPD to lock in a $5M raise in 2022 while no other city employees are allowed to collectively bargain AND face drastic cuts to their agency budgets. The 2021 budget includes minor increases to programs designed as alternatives to policing (STAR, etc.) with funding from external sources ‚Äì these budgetary increases did not decrease the DPD budget in any way.

Tell your councilperson to stand firm and say NO to this contract!

[image:
-Ortega, At Large 720-337-7713 Ortegaatlarge@denvergov.org @OrtegaAtLarge
-Kniech, At Large 720-337-7712 kniechatlarge@denvergov.org. @KniechAtLarge

item.title: Councilwoman Sandoval is matching donations to Bienvenidos!...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social Justice

Councilwoman Sandoval is matching donations to Bienvenidos! Pitch in to help feed our community.

Bienvenidos Food Bank can turn every $1 into $9 worth of food. Councilwoman Amanda P. Sandoval would like to turn your $1 into $18 of food by matching the first $1,000 of donations. Times are tougher than ever but every $1 helps, if you can give please give, if you need help, know that Bienvenidos F...

item.title: Support needed:
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social Justice

Support needed:

Denver Homeless Out Loud

SWEEP -- 22nd n Wazee on Tue (despite snow /27) and SWEEP -- Central Library Thur (over 40 tents!)
----
The city is not interested in aiding or housing our h...omeless (or they would house them) they are only instersted in getting them out of sight.

So the City has decided to move forward and sweep people in the snow in 27 degree weather. The sweep at 22nd and Wazee is scheduled for Tuesday 11/10/20. The sweep scheduled for the Central Library is scheduled for Thursday 11/12/20. The Central Library location has over 40 tents!

For Tuesday and Thursday come and support with the following items...

-Truck, or any vehicle to help move
-Carts
-Bungee Cords
-Rope
-Trash Bags
-Food
-Coffee/CoCo
-Water

Your assistance is much appreciated! Somewhere around 6:30am and all morning help will likely be needed.

Toward Rights, Dignity and Housing‚Ä¶

Contact:
info@denverhomelessoutloud.org
720-940-5291

See More

item.title: Toothbrushes and toothpaste needed
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social Justice

Toothbrushes and toothpaste needed

‚ÄéD LR Parks‚Äé to Taskforce Denver Homeless

My department (Bayaud Works) is managing a emergency homeless shelter for women and we need toothbrushes and toothpaste for the guest.

Please let me know if you want to donate, anything would be appreciated.

#employmentopportunities #cityofdenver #homelessness #safety #hygiene

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeTammy Bellofatto shared a photo to the group: Taskforce Denver Homeless.If you are looking for a place to...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeTammy Bellofatto shared a photo to the group: Taskforce Denver Homeless.

If you are looking for a place to donate toys

Travis Singhaus updated his cover photo.

For the last 8 years Impact has been collecting toys for families in need at homeless shelters around the Metro area. Together let's make sure that every child ...gets a visit from Santa this year!

Now more than ever these kids deserve something positive in their lives!

To find a drop off location near you go to www.impactlocally.org/toy-drive

Due to Covid-19 precautions we are asking that the toys be new and unwrappped.

THANK YOU IN ADVANCE FOR BEING AMAZING!

See More

FYI: The NAACP is working with @Lyft to offer free, safe rides to polling stations and registered drop box locations across the U.S from now through Election Day. #RideToVote

item.content:encoded:

It‚Äôs Election Day! If you didn‚Äôt get a ballot, lost it, or haven‚Äôt registered then you can vote TODAY in person, polls close at 7:00 PM.

If you‚Äôre voting by mail ballot, make sure to return it by 7:00 PM.

You can find a drop box or in-person voting center near you at GoVoteColorado.gov

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeAmplifierWe are so excited to share this NEW ARTWORK created by Holy Moly UK to uplift voting in the upcoming...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeAmplifier

We are so excited to share this NEW ARTWORK created by Holy Moly UK to uplift voting in the upcoming election. Download the artwork for free at amplifier.org üîäüîä...üîä

From Carl about the piece, ‚ÄùMy design aims to encourage voting in the upcoming US election. I wanted the message to be vibrant, to sing with colour and positivity for the future. There is still hope, but we need to make very bold decisions regarding the environment. The US needs a leader that is more focused on global issues than their own twitter feed! US friends if you are reading this please vote, it is so so important!‚Äù

For first time, Denver enacts police command center for potential election unrest

Denver‚Äôs top officials will launch a police command post in preparation for potential post-election unrest ‚Äî the first time the city has taken such measures around an election.Denver‚Äôs top officials will launch a police command post in preparation for potential post-election unrest ‚Äî the first time the city has taken such measures around an election.

item.title: North Denver for Social JusticeGovernor Jared PolisToday, in close consultation with legislative leadership, I am ordering one-time $375...
item.content:encoded:
North Denver for Social JusticeGovernor Jared Polis

Today, in close consultation with legislative leadership, I am ordering one-time $375 stimulus payments to 435,000 qualifying Coloradans whose lives and jobs ha...ve been hurt due to the COVID-19 pandemic.

I've taken this action because many Coloradans can‚Äôt afford to wait while Washington D.C. continues to negotiate a relief package. This will provide additional direct cash support for hardworking Coloradans to further stimulate the economy.

We're thankful to all the members of the GA who joined us in this effort to get direct payments to Coloradans including Senator Leroy Garcia, KC Becker for Colorado State House, Garnett for Colorado, Senator Steve Fenberg, Representative Daneya Esgar, HD 46, Senator Dominick Moreno, Representative Julie McCluskie, Rachel Zenzinger for Colorado, State Representative Shannon Bird, Jeff Bridges for Colorado, Representative Kyle Mullica, House District 34, Kerry Donovan

READ MORE: https://www.colorado.gov/‚Ä¶/3311-governor-polis-legislative-‚Ä¶

See More
